intro: Sabulina polygonoides, commonly known as the sand snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it has a fibrous root system adapted to its harsh habitat. Sabulina polygonoides is often found in open areas such as grasslands, dunes, and along roadsides.
